message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.DB, cs.SI, cs.LG

This paper deals with the problem of detecting vandalism in Wikidata, which is a large-scale knowledge base. The problem involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques to analyze the text of revisions and identify whether they are acts of vandalism or not. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques to retrieve relevant information from the knowledge base, which makes cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another likely sub-category. The paper also involves database (DB) techniques to store and retrieve the revisions, which makes cs.DB (Databases) another likely sub-category. The paper also involves machine learning (ML) techniques to train a model to detect vandalism, which makes cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely sub-categories as well.
